learning_outcomes.description: Define and describe the key concepts, determinants, and indicators of mental health and wellbeing.
Describe key features of major mental health disorders with reference to current diagnostic classification systems (e.g., DSM-5).
Analyse presenting information to consider possible diagnoses and differential diagnoses using current classification systems (e.g., DSM-5).
Integrate and apply a biopsychosocial framework to the assessment and formulation of individuals experiencing mental illness and their carers.
Conduct a comprehensive assessment including history taking and mental status examination and synthesise findings into a written case report.
Demonstrate the ability to select and describe culturally safe strategies for counselling practice with diverse populations.
Synthesise assessment data and research evidence to develop coherent, client-centred treatment plans.

assessments.task_description:
You will watch a video recorded first session between a therapist and a client.

As an observer you are taking notes using the biopsychosocial approach to get a sense of the client's story and you will then produce a detailed case study report (an example template is provided of what a possible Case Study Report can look like on Blackboard).

Criteria and Marking

Maximum 12-double-spaced A4 pages including references – font Times New Roman, Size 12, Margins 2.54.

The case report will be marked using the following criteria:

  • Assessment - Evidence of a thorough assessment having been conducted, including a Mental Status Exam (12 marks)
  • Diagnosis & Differential Diagnoses - Justification provided for the diagnosis given, and evidence that differential diagnoses have been considered (7 marks)
  • Formulation - A clear formulation of the case provided in appropriate format and supported by the assessment information collected (8 marks)
  • Treatment Recommendations - Clear treatment recommendations provided, this could include suggestions for further information needed, with reference to empirical research (5 marks)
  • Writing style and organisation – The report is written in a clear, professional and well-organised manner. Grammar and spelling are correct. No need for APA formatting but do include referencing in line with APA formatting. (3 marks)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must be submitted in electronic version via Turn-it-in.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Multiple choice online quiz: Covering all lectures conducted up to and including Trauma Lecture. 30 MCQ items, each item is worth 1%. 45 minutes to complete. Closed book.

assessments.task_description:
Video Assessment

  • In this video assessment with reflection, you will conduct a role-play assessment with a client. You will be allocated into pairs with another student from the course, by your tutor. In your pairs, in one 20-minute video you will play the role of therapist and your partner will play the client, and then in a second 20-minute video you reverse roles. You will be required to make an 18-20-minute (maximum) video, which you will submit (you only submit the video in which you were the therapist).
  • As the Therapist, your job will be focused on conducting a Review of Social Systems by asking SOCIAL questions. S = Social Resources (friends, groups, social influences), O = Occupation (paid word or other social roles valued by others), C = Children & Family (including relatives), I = Income (sources of material resources), A = Abilities (appearance, health, time and other personal resources), and L = Love (and intimate relationships). Your job as the therapist is to ask about these SOCIAL questions in creative ways. You do not have to cover all these questions in the 20 minutes, you are not being assessed on that.
  • As the Client you will play either someone presenting with symptoms from either the 1) psychosis, or 2) substance use lecture
  • Successful submission of a 20-minute video of you as the Therapist (no less than 18-min and no more than 20-min) will result in an awarding of 10 marks

Written Reflection

  • A 1-page, single space, 12-point-font, margins 2.54cm, written reflection is to be submitted via Blackboard regarding the key learnings you have had as a result of the assessment video. Include the link to your video recording in the reflection.

Subheadings to include:

  • Strengths - in this section write about 2 things you did well. Give the time stamp of that section in the video (e.g., 12 minutes 22 seconds) and include what you did (e.g., a specific question) and a justification for why you thought this was a good demonstration of skill (e.g., it helped provide clear evidence in support for a certain disorder). (5 marks)
  • Areas to Improve - in this section write about 2 things you think you could improve on. Give the time stamp for the section in the video (e.g., 5 minutes and 12 seconds) and include what you did (e.g., a specific question), and a justification for why you thought you needed to improve here (e.g., there were three questions in the one question making it difficult for the client to answer). (5 marks)
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Across the semester, in your own time but completed before May 28th at 12pm, you are required to complete three modules on Indigenous Health.

All modules can be accessed through Blackboard, and each Module covers a specific topic, and will include audio and video material.

You will need to complete three modules:

  • Module 1: History, Identity, Cultural, Practice, & Policy
  • Module 2: Contemporary Health
  • Module 3: Cultural Safety in Health and Community Services


Written Reflection

  • A 1-page, single space, 12-point-font, margins 2.54cm, written reflection is to be submitted via Blackboard


You will be asked to complete a one-page reflection response to this question:

  1. Reflecting on what you have learned in the three modules, describe at least three respectful and appropriate approaches you will use to practise cultural safety when working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Reflections must be submitted in electronic version via Turn-it-in.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
